result.execSummary:
The defendant Micah Allen Minor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Micah Allen Minor appeared from jail. Case called at 3:39 pm. Court reviews file and maximum penalities. ADA Nieskes updates Court and provides sentencing recommendation. Atty. Caton responds. DE addresses Court. 

Court QUASHES WARRANT. Crt orders:
Count 1 - Felony Mistreatment of Animals  S/W 2 years probation with conditions
Conditions:
- MRT program, if COMPAS indicates qualification
- Obtain GED
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Mental Health Treatment and take prescribed medications
- Subject to random testing to monitor sobriety compliance.
- Costs collectible through probation
- $275.50 restitution collectible through probation
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Count 2 
-  6 mos St. Croix County Jail, time can be served in Dunn County, concurrent with Dunn County sentence, 80 days credit and credit for good time
- Huber granted for purposes of employment, seek work and education
-Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge, enter civil judgment
- Costs, enter civil judgment
- Count 1 eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. Micah Allen Minor pro se. Case called at 4:26. Court reviews file. DE has just made contact with his agent and has an appt. with his agent tomorrow. DE is not working and has not completed his AODA. DE has contacted someone about finishing his GED. Court will set out for 4 months and at that time MRT is to be done and AODA assessment done and DE to keep appointments with his agent. If DE has a job by then he can call to have the next hearing rescheduled to fit his employment. Agent to provide a letter to the Court a week in advance of the hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

Prior: N9637 560th Street, Colfax, WI 54730 
per Defendant's bond. eif
Probation review hearing at 12-14-2015 04:30 pm

-No firearms.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Donna S. or her daughter or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. Including Social Media. 

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  William A. Schembera DF:  Micah Allen Minor appeared. Case called at 8:07. ADA Nieskes updates the court, the DJOC is being prepared. Recess at 8:09. Case recalled at 8:29. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 and 2  in 15CF52. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and with holds entry of the judgment signing the agreement and guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CF52. Sentencing arguments. DE has a bail jumping charge in Dunn Co. Crt orders:

On Ct. 1: DJOC court signs agreement. 

On Ct. 2: Sentence W/H
1 year probation with conditions
- 90 days in St. Croix County Jail. STAY 75 days and Impose 15 days to commence no later than November 13. Time can be transferred to Dunn County. 
  Huber granted for employment. 
- AODA and any follow through with any recommended treatement.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.  This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Costs and costs of supervision. 
- Participation in MRT. 
- Restitution of $275.50. 


Court orders the 275.50 of bond to be release for restitution. 
DE to report to probation and MRT today. Probation agent to send update a week prior to review. 
Court has no objection to probation being transferred to Dunn County.  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Nieskes. Requesting a plea date. km
Plea hearing at 09-23-2015 08:00 am
Jury trial at 09-10-2015 08:00 am
